name.description: A friendly name or description for the interface or VLAN.

subnet.description: The network that this routed interface is on, in CIDR notation (ex. 10.1.1.0/24).

interfaceIp.description: The IP address this switch stack will use for layer 3 routing on this VLAN or subnet. This cannot be the same as the switch's management IP.

multicastRouting.description: Enable multicast support if, multicast routing between VLANs is required. Options are, 'disabled', 'enabled' or 'IGMP snooping querier'. Default is 'disabled'.

vlanId.description: The VLAN this routed interface is on. VLAN must be between 1 and 4094.

defaultGateway.description: The next hop for any traffic that isn't going to a directly connected subnet or over a static route. This IP address must exist in a subnet with a routed interface.

area.description: The OSPF area to which this interface should belong. Can be either 'disabled' or the identifier of an existing OSPF area. Defaults to 'disabled'.

cost.description: The path cost for this interface. Defaults to 1, but can be increased up to 65535 to give lower priority.

isPassiveEnabled.description: When enabled, OSPF will not run on the interface, but the subnet will still be advertised.

ospfSettings.description: The OSPF routing settings of the interface.

area.description: The OSPFv3 area to which this interface should belong. Can be either 'disabled' or the identifier of an existing OSPFv3 area. Defaults to 'disabled'.

cost.description: The path cost for this interface. Defaults to 1, but can be increased up to 65535 to give lower priority.

isPassiveEnabled.description: When enabled, OSPFv3 will not run on the interface, but the subnet will still be advertised.

ospfV3.description: The OSPFv3 routing settings of the interface.

assignmentMode.description: The IPv6 assignment mode for the interface. Can be either 'eui-64' or 'static'.

prefix.description: The IPv6 prefix of the interface. Required if IPv6 object is included.

address.description: The IPv6 address of the interface. Required if assignmentMode is 'static'. Must not be included if assignmentMode is 'eui-64'.

gateway.description: The IPv6 default gateway of the interface. Required if prefix is defined and this is the first interface with IPv6 configured for the stack.

ipv6.description: The IPv6 settings of the interface.

price.description: The price of the billing plan.

limitUp.description: The maximum upload limit (integer, in Kbps). null indicates no limit

limitDown.description: The maximum download limit (integer, in Kbps). null indicates no limit

plans.description: Array of billing plans in the node group. (Can configure a maximum of 5)

get.description: Return AP channel utilization over time for a device or network client

parameters.name: t0
parameters.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 31 days from today.

parameters.name: t1
parameters.description: The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 31 days after t0.

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 31 days. The default is 7 days.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: The time resolution in seconds for returned data. The valid resolutions are: 600, 1200, 3600, 14400, 86400. The default is 86400.

parameters.name: autoResolution
parameters.description: Automatically select a data resolution based on the given timespan; this overrides the value specified by the 'resolution' parameter. The default setting is false.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: Filter results by network client to return per-device, per-band AP channel utilization metrics inner joined by the queried client's connection history.

parameters.name: deviceSerial
parameters.description: Filter results by device to return AP channel utilization metrics for the queried device; either :band or :clientId must be jointly specified.

parameters.name: apTag
parameters.description: Filter results by AP tag to return AP channel utilization metrics for devices labeled with the given tag; either :clientId or :deviceSerial must be jointly specified.

parameters.name: band
parameters.description: Filter results by band (either '2.4', '5' or '6').

startTs.description: The start time of the query range

endTs.description: The end time of the query range

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 1000.

parameters.name: startingAfter
parameters.description: A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

parameters.name: endingBefore
parameters.description: A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

parameters.name: t0
parameters.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 31 days from today.

parameters.name: t1
parameters.description: The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 31 days after t0.

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 31 days. The default is 1 day.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: A list of event types to include. If not specified, events of all types will be returned. Valid types are 'assoc', 'disassoc', 'auth', 'deauth', 'dns', 'dhcp', 'roam', 'connection' and/or 'sticky'.

parameters.name: includedSeverities
parameters.description: A list of severities to include. If not specified, events of all severities will be returned. Valid severities are 'good', 'info', 'warn' and/or 'bad'.

parameters.name: band
parameters.description: Filter results by band (either '2.4', '5', '6').

parameters.name: ssidNumber
parameters.description: An SSID number to include. If not specified, events for all SSIDs will be returned.

parameters.name: deviceSerial
parameters.description: Filter results by an AP's serial number.

Link.description: A comma-separated list of first, last, prev, and next relative links used for subsequent paginated requests.

get.description: Return the latency history for a client. Clients can be identified by a client key or either the MAC or IP depending on whether the network uses Track-by-IP. The latency data is from a sample of 2% of packets and is grouped into 4 traffic categories: background, best effort, video, voice. Within these categories the sampled packet counters are bucketed by latency in milliseconds.

parameters.name: t0
parameters.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 791 days from today.

parameters.name: t1
parameters.description: The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 791 days after t0.

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 791 days. The default is 1 day.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: The time resolution in seconds for returned data. The valid resolutions are: 86400. The default is 86400.

get.description: List the non-basic RF profiles for this network

parameters.name: includeTemplateProfiles
parameters.description: If the network is bound to a template, this parameter controls whether or not the non-basic RF profiles defined on the template should be included in the response alongside the non-basic profiles defined on the bound network. Defaults to false.

get.summary: List the non-basic RF profiles for this network

post.description: Creates new RF profile for this network

name.description: The name of the new profile. Must be unique. This param is required on creation.

clientBalancingEnabled.description: Steers client to best available access point. Can be either true or false. Defaults to true.

minBitrateType.description: Minimum bitrate can be set to either 'band' or 'ssid'. Defaults to band.

bandSelectionType.description: Band selection can be set to either 'ssid' or 'ap'. This param is required on creation.

bandOperationMode.description: Choice between 'dual', '2.4ghz' or '5ghz'. Defaults to dual.

bandSteeringEnabled.description: Steers client to most open band. Can be either true or false. Defaults to true.

apBandSettings.description: Settings that will be enabled if selectionType is set to 'ap'.

maxPower.description: Sets max power (dBm) of 2.4Ghz band. Can be integer between 5 and 30. Defaults to 30.

minPower.description: Sets min power (dBm) of 2.4Ghz band. Can be integer between 5 and 30. Defaults to 5.

minBitrate.description: Sets min bitrate (Mbps) of 2.4Ghz band. Can be one of '1', '2', '5.5', '6', '9', '11', '12', '18', '24', '36', '48' or '54'. Defaults to 11.

validAutoChannels.description: Sets valid auto channels for 2.4Ghz band. Can be one of '1', '6' or '11'. Defaults to [1, 6, 11].

axEnabled.description: Determines whether ax radio on 2.4Ghz band is on or off. Can be either true or false. If false, we highly recommend disabling band steering. Defaults to true.

rxsop.description: The RX-SOP level controls the sensitivity of the radio. It is strongly recommended to use RX-SOP only after consulting a wireless expert. RX-SOP can be configured in the range of -65 to -95 (dBm). A value of null will reset this to the default.

maxPower.description: Sets max power (dBm) of 5Ghz band. Can be integer between 8 and 30. Defaults to 30.

minPower.description: Sets min power (dBm) of 5Ghz band. Can be integer between 8 and 30. Defaults to 8.

minBitrate.description: Sets min bitrate (Mbps) of 5Ghz band. Can be one of '6', '9', '12', '18', '24', '36', '48' or '54'. Defaults to 12.

channelWidth.description: Sets channel width (MHz) for 5Ghz band. Can be one of 'auto', '20', '40' or '80'. Defaults to auto.

rxsop.description: The RX-SOP level controls the sensitivity of the radio. It is strongly recommended to use RX-SOP only after consulting a wireless expert. RX-SOP can be configured in the range of -65 to -95 (dBm). A value of null will reset this to the default.

enabled.description: Toggle for radio transmission. When false, radios will not transmit at all.

minBitrate.description: Sets min bitrate (Mbps) of this SSID. Can be one of '1', '2', '5.5', '6', '9', '11', '12', '18', '24', '36', '48' or '54'.

bandSteeringEnabled.description: Steers client to most open band between 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz. Can be either true or false.

minBitrate.description: Sets min bitrate (Mbps) of this SSID. Can be one of '1', '2', '5.5', '6', '9', '11', '12', '18', '24', '36', '48' or '54'.

bandSteeringEnabled.description: Steers client to most open band between 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz. Can be either true or false.

minBitrate.description: Sets min bitrate (Mbps) of this SSID. Can be one of '1', '2', '5.5', '6', '9', '11', '12', '18', '24', '36', '48' or '54'.

bandSteeringEnabled.description: Steers client to most open band between 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz. Can be either true or false.

minBitrate.description: Sets min bitrate (Mbps) of this SSID. Can be one of '1', '2', '5.5', '6', '9', '11', '12', '18', '24', '36', '48' or '54'.

bandSteeringEnabled.description: Steers client to most open band between 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz. Can be either true or false.

duration.description: The duration in minutes that devices will refrain from using dirty VLANs before adding them back to the pool.

ledLightsOn.description: Toggle for enabling or disabling LED lights on all APs in the network (making them run dark)

enabled.description: Whether or not devices using named VLAN pools should remove dirty VLANs from the pool, thereby preventing clients from being assigned to VLANs where they would be unable to obtain an IP address via DHCP

duration.description: The duration in minutes that devices will refrain from using dirty VLANs before adding them back to the pool.

poolDhcpMonitoring.description: Named VLAN Pool DHCP Monitoring settings.

namedVlans.description: Named VLAN settings for wireless networks.

get.description: Return signal quality (SNR/RSSI) over time for a device or network client

parameters.name: t0
parameters.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 31 days from today.

parameters.name: t1
parameters.description: The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 31 days after t0.

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 31 days. The default is 7 days.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: The time resolution in seconds for returned data. The valid resolutions are: 300, 600, 1200, 3600, 14400, 86400. The default is 86400.

parameters.name: autoResolution
parameters.description: Automatically select a data resolution based on the given timespan; this overrides the value specified by the 'resolution' parameter. The default setting is false.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: Filter results by network client.

parameters.name: deviceSerial
parameters.description: Filter results by device.

parameters.name: apTag
parameters.description: Filter results by AP tag; either :clientId or :deviceSerial must be jointly specified.

parameters.name: band
parameters.description: Filter results by band (either '2.4', '5' or '6').

parameters.name: ssid
parameters.description: Filter results by SSID number.

startTs.description: The start time of the query range

endTs.description: The end time of the query range

get.summary: Return signal quality (SNR/RSSI) over time for a device or network client

put.description: Update the attributes of an MR SSID

enabled.description: Whether or not the SSID is enabled

authMode.description: The association control method for the SSID ('open', 'open-enhanced', 'psk', 'open-with-radius', '8021x-meraki', '8021x-nac', '8021x-radius', '8021x-google', '8021x-localradius', 'ipsk-with-radius' or 'ipsk-without-radius')

enterpriseAdminAccess.description: Whether or not an SSID is accessible by 'enterprise' administrators ('access disabled' or 'access enabled')

encryptionMode.description: The psk encryption mode for the SSID ('wep' or 'wpa'). This param is only valid if the authMode is 'psk'

psk.description: The passkey for the SSID. This param is only valid if the authMode is 'psk'

wpaEncryptionMode.description: The types of WPA encryption. ('WPA1 only', 'WPA1 and WPA2', 'WPA2 only', 'WPA3 Transition Mode' or 'WPA3 only')

enabled.description: Whether 802.11w is enabled or not.

dot11w.description: The current setting for Protected Management Frames (802.11w).

enabled.description: Whether 802.11r is enabled or not.

splashPage.description: The type of splash page for the SSID ('None', 'Click-through splash page', 'Billing', 'Password-protected with Meraki RADIUS', 'Password-protected with custom RADIUS', 'Password-protected with Active Directory', 'Password-protected with LDAP', 'SMS authentication', 'Systems Manager Sentry', 'Facebook Wi-Fi', 'Google OAuth', 'Sponsored guest', 'Cisco ISE' or 'Google Apps domain'). This attribute is not supported for template children.

splashGuestSponsorDomains.description: Array of valid sponsor email domains for sponsored guest splash type.

allowedDomains.description: (Optional) The list of domains allowed access to the network.

oauth.description: The OAuth settings of this SSID. Only valid if splashPage is 'Google OAuth'.

cacheTimeout.description: The duration (in seconds) for which LDAP and OCSP lookups are cached.

enabled.description: Whether or not to use EAP-TTLS/PAP or PEAP-GTC password-based authentication via LDAP lookup.

passwordAuthentication.description: The current setting for password-based authentication.

enabled.description: Whether or not to use EAP-TLS certificate-based authentication to validate wireless clients.

useLdap.description: Whether or not to verify the certificate with LDAP.

useOcsp.description: Whether or not to verify the certificate with OCSP.

ocspResponderUrl.description: (Optional) The URL of the OCSP responder to verify client certificate status.

contents.description: The contents of the Client CA Certificate. Must be in PEM or DER format.

clientRootCaCertificate.description: The Client CA Certificate used to sign the client certificate.

certificateAuthentication.description: The current setting for certificate verification.

localRadius.description: The current setting for Local Authentication, a built-in RADIUS server on the access point. Only valid if authMode is '8021x-localradius'.

host.description: IP address of your LDAP server.

port.description: UDP port the LDAP server listens on.

servers.description: The LDAP servers to be used for authentication.

distinguishedName.description: The distinguished name of the LDAP user account (example: cn=user,dc=meraki,dc=com).

password.description: The password of the LDAP user account.

credentials.description: (Optional) The credentials of the user account to be used by the AP to bind to your LDAP server. The LDAP account should have permissions on all your LDAP servers.

baseDistinguishedName.description: The base distinguished name of users on the LDAP server.

contents.description: The contents of the CA certificate. Must be in PEM or DER format.

serverCaCertificate.description: The CA certificate used to sign the LDAP server's key.

ldap.description: The current setting for LDAP. Only valid if splashPage is 'Password-protected with LDAP'.

host.description: IP address of your Active Directory server.

port.description: (Optional) UDP port the Active Directory server listens on. By default, uses port 3268.

servers.description: The Active Directory servers to be used for authentication.

logonName.description: The logon name of the Active Directory account.

password.description: The password to the Active Directory user account.

credentials.description: (Optional) The credentials of the user account to be used by the AP to bind to your Active Directory server. The Active Directory account should have permissions on all your Active Directory servers. Only valid if the splashPage is 'Password-protected with Active Directory'.

activeDirectory.description: The current setting for Active Directory. Only valid if splashPage is 'Password-protected with Active Directory'

host.description: IP address of your RADIUS server

port.description: UDP port the RADIUS server listens on for Access-requests

radsecEnabled.description: Use RADSEC (TLS over TCP) to connect to this RADIUS server. Requires radiusProxyEnabled.

openRoamingCertificateId.description: The ID of the Openroaming Certificate attached to radius server.

caCertificate.description: Certificate used for authorization for the RADSEC Server

radiusServers.description: The RADIUS 802.1X servers to be used for authentication. This param is only valid if the authMode is 'open-with-radius', '8021x-radius' or 'ipsk-with-radius'

radiusProxyEnabled.description: If true, Meraki devices will proxy RADIUS messages through the Meraki cloud to the configured RADIUS auth and accounting servers.

radiusTestingEnabled.description: If true, Meraki devices will periodically send Access-Request messages to configured RADIUS servers using identity 'meraki_8021x_test' to ensure that the RADIUS servers are reachable.

radiusCalledStationId.description: The template of the called station identifier to be used for RADIUS (ex. $NODE_MAC$:$VAP_NUM$).

radiusAuthenticationNasId.description: The template of the NAS identifier to be used for RADIUS authentication (ex. $NODE_MAC$:$VAP_NUM$).

radiusServerTimeout.description: The amount of time for which a RADIUS client waits for a reply from the RADIUS server (must be between 1-10 seconds).

radiusServerAttemptsLimit.description: The maximum number of transmit attempts after which a RADIUS server is failed over (must be between 1-5).

radiusFallbackEnabled.description: Whether or not higher priority RADIUS servers should be retried after 60 seconds.

radiusCoaEnabled.description: If true, Meraki devices will act as a RADIUS Dynamic Authorization Server and will respond to RADIUS Change-of-Authorization and Disconnect messages sent by the RADIUS server.

radiusFailoverPolicy.description: This policy determines how authentication requests should be handled in the event that all of the configured RADIUS servers are unreachable ('Deny access' or 'Allow access')

radiusLoadBalancingPolicy.description: This policy determines which RADIUS server will be contacted first in an authentication attempt and the ordering of any necessary retry attempts ('Strict priority order' or 'Round robin')

radiusAccountingEnabled.description: Whether or not RADIUS accounting is enabled. This param is only valid if the authMode is 'open-with-radius', '8021x-radius' or 'ipsk-with-radius'

host.description: IP address to which the APs will send RADIUS accounting messages

port.description: Port on the RADIUS server that is listening for accounting messages

secret.description: Shared key used to authenticate messages between the APs and RADIUS server

radsecEnabled.description: Use RADSEC (TLS over TCP) to connect to this RADIUS accounting server. Requires radiusProxyEnabled.

caCertificate.description: Certificate used for authorization for the RADSEC Server

radiusAccountingServers.description: The RADIUS accounting 802.1X servers to be used for authentication. This param is only valid if the authMode is 'open-with-radius', '8021x-radius' or 'ipsk-with-radius' and radiusAccountingEnabled is 'true'

radiusAccountingInterimInterval.description: The interval (in seconds) in which accounting information is updated and sent to the RADIUS accounting server.

radiusAttributeForGroupPolicies.description: Specify the RADIUS attribute used to look up group policies ('Filter-Id', 'Reply-Message', 'Airespace-ACL-Name' or 'Aruba-User-Role'). Access points must receive this attribute in the RADIUS Access-Accept message

ipAssignmentMode.description: The client IP assignment mode ('NAT mode', 'Bridge mode', 'Layer 3 roaming', 'Ethernet over GRE', 'Layer 3 roaming with a concentrator' or 'VPN')

useVlanTagging.description: Whether or not traffic should be directed to use specific VLANs. This param is only valid if the ipAssignmentMode is 'Bridge mode' or 'Layer 3 roaming'

concentratorNetworkId.description: The concentrator to use when the ipAssignmentMode is 'Layer 3 roaming with a concentrator' or 'VPN'.

secondaryConcentratorNetworkId.description: The secondary concentrator to use when the ipAssignmentMode is 'VPN'. If configured, the APs will switch to using this concentrator if the primary concentrator is unreachable. This param is optional. ('disabled' represents no secondary concentrator.)

disassociateClientsOnVpnFailover.description: Disassociate clients when 'VPN' concentrator failover occurs in order to trigger clients to re-associate and generate new DHCP requests. This param is only valid if ipAssignmentMode is 'VPN'.

vlanId.description: The VLAN ID used for VLAN tagging. This param is only valid when the ipAssignmentMode is 'Layer 3 roaming with a concentrator' or 'VPN'

defaultVlanId.description: The default VLAN ID used for 'all other APs'. This param is only valid when the ipAssignmentMode is 'Bridge mode' or 'Layer 3 roaming'

tags.description: Array of AP tags

vlanId.description: Numerical identifier that is assigned to the VLAN

apTagsAndVlanIds.description: The list of tags and VLAN IDs used for VLAN tagging. This param is only valid when the ipAssignmentMode is 'Bridge mode' or 'Layer 3 roaming'

walledGardenEnabled.description: Allow access to a configurable list of IP ranges, which users may access prior to sign-on.

walledGardenRanges.description: Specify your walled garden by entering an array of addresses, ranges using CIDR notation, domain names, and domain wildcards (e.g. '192.168.1.1/24', '192.168.37.10/32', 'www.yahoo.com', '*.google.com']). Meraki's splash page is automatically included in your walled garden.

host.description: The EoGRE concentrator's IP or FQDN. This param is required when ipAssignmentMode is 'Ethernet over GRE'.

key.description: Optional numerical identifier that will add the GRE key field to the GRE header. Used to identify an individual traffic flow within a tunnel.

radiusOverride.description: If true, the RADIUS response can override VLAN tag. This is not valid when ipAssignmentMode is 'NAT mode'.

radiusGuestVlanEnabled.description: Whether or not RADIUS Guest VLAN is enabled. This param is only valid if the authMode is 'open-with-radius' and addressing mode is not set to 'isolated' or 'nat' mode

radiusGuestVlanId.description: VLAN ID of the RADIUS Guest VLAN. This param is only valid if the authMode is 'open-with-radius' and addressing mode is not set to 'isolated' or 'nat' mode

minBitrate.description: The minimum bitrate in Mbps of this SSID in the default indoor RF profile. ('1', '2', '5.5', '6', '9', '11', '12', '18', '24', '36', '48' or '54')

bandSelection.description: The client-serving radio frequencies of this SSID in the default indoor RF profile. ('Dual band operation', '5 GHz band only' or 'Dual band operation with Band Steering')

perClientBandwidthLimitUp.description: The upload bandwidth limit in Kbps. (0 represents no limit.)

perClientBandwidthLimitDown.description: The download bandwidth limit in Kbps. (0 represents no limit.)

perSsidBandwidthLimitUp.description: The total upload bandwidth limit in Kbps. (0 represents no limit.)

perSsidBandwidthLimitDown.description: The total download bandwidth limit in Kbps. (0 represents no limit.)

lanIsolationEnabled.description: Boolean indicating whether Layer 2 LAN isolation should be enabled or disabled. Only configurable when ipAssignmentMode is 'Bridge mode'.

visible.description: Boolean indicating whether APs should advertise or hide this SSID. APs will only broadcast this SSID if set to true

availableOnAllAps.description: Boolean indicating whether all APs should broadcast the SSID or if it should be restricted to APs matching any availability tags. Can only be false if the SSID has availability tags.

availabilityTags.description: Accepts a list of tags for this SSID. If availableOnAllAps is false, then the SSID will only be broadcast by APs with tags matching any of the tags in this list.

mandatoryDhcpEnabled.description: If true, Mandatory DHCP will enforce that clients connecting to this SSID must use the IP address assigned by the DHCP server. Clients who use a static IP address won't be able to associate.

adultContentFilteringEnabled.description: Boolean indicating whether or not adult content will be blocked

enabled.description: Boolean indicating whether or not DNS server rewrite is enabled. If disabled, upstream DNS will be used

dnsCustomNameservers.description: User specified DNS servers (up to two servers)

enabled.description: Boolean indicating whether or not to allow users to temporarily exceed the bandwidth limit for short periods while still keeping them under the bandwidth limit over time.

speedBurst.description: The SpeedBurst setting for this SSID'

redirectUrl.description: The custom redirect URL where the users will go after the splash page.

controllerDisconnectionBehavior.description: How login attempts should be handled when the controller is unreachable. Can be either 'open', 'restricted', or 'default'.

freeAccess.description: Details associated with a free access plan with limits.

put.description: Update the traffic shaping settings for an SSID on an MR network

trafficShapingEnabled.description: Whether traffic shaping rules are applied to clients on your SSID.

defaultRulesEnabled.description: Whether default traffic shaping rules are enabled (true) or disabled (false). There are 4 default rules, which can be seen on your network's traffic shaping page. Note that default rules count against the rule limit of 8.

type.description: The type of definition. Can be one of 'application', 'applicationCategory', 'host', 'port', 'ipRange' or 'localNet'.

value.description:
If "type" is 'host', 'port', 'ipRange' or 'localNet', then "value" must be a string, matching either
    a hostname (e.g. "somesite.com"), a port (e.g. 8080), or an IP range ("192.1.0.0",
    "192.1.0.0/16", or "10.1.0.0/16:80"). 'localNet' also supports CIDR notation, excluding
    custom ports.
     If "type" is 'application' or 'applicationCategory', then "value" must be an object
    with the structure { "id": "meraki:layer7/..." }, where "id" is the application category or
    application ID (for a list of IDs for your network, use the trafficShaping/applicationCategories
    endpoint).

definitions.description: A list of objects describing the definitions of your traffic shaping rule. At least one definition is required.

settings.description: How bandwidth limits are applied by your rule. Can be one of 'network default', 'ignore' or 'custom'.

limitUp.description: The maximum upload limit (integer, in Kbps).

limitDown.description: The maximum download limit (integer, in Kbps).

bandwidthLimits.description: The bandwidth limits object, specifying the upload ('limitUp') and download ('limitDown') speed in Kbps. These are only enforced if 'settings' is set to 'custom'.

perClientBandwidthLimits.description: An object describing the bandwidth settings for your rule.

dscpTagValue.description:
The DSCP tag applied by your rule. null means 'Do not change DSCP tag'.
    For a list of possible tag values, use the trafficShaping/dscpTaggingOptions endpoint.

pcpTagValue.description:
The PCP tag applied by your rule. Can be 0 (lowest priority) through 7 (highest priority).
    null means 'Do not set PCP tag'.

rules.description:
An array of traffic shaping rules. Rules are applied in the order that
    they are specified in. An empty list (or null) means no rules. Note that
    you are allowed a maximum of 8 rules.

put.summary: Update the traffic shaping settings for an SSID on an MR network

get.description: Return AP usage over time for a device or network client

parameters.name: t0
parameters.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 31 days from today.

parameters.name: t1
parameters.description: The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 31 days after t0.

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 31 days. The default is 7 days.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: The time resolution in seconds for returned data. The valid resolutions are: 300, 600, 1200, 3600, 14400, 86400. The default is 86400.

parameters.name: autoResolution
parameters.description: Automatically select a data resolution based on the given timespan; this overrides the value specified by the 'resolution' parameter. The default setting is false.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: Filter results by network client to return per-device AP usage over time inner joined by the queried client's connection history.

parameters.name: deviceSerial
parameters.description: Filter results by device. Requires :band.

parameters.name: apTag
parameters.description: Filter results by AP tag; either :clientId or :deviceSerial must be jointly specified.

parameters.name: band
parameters.description: Filter results by band (either '2.4', '5' or '6').

parameters.name: ssid
parameters.description: Filter results by SSID number.

startTs.description: The start time of the query range

endTs.description: The end time of the query range

get.summary: Return AP usage over time for a device or network client

get.description: List the API requests made by an organization

parameters.name: t0
parameters.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 31 days from today.

parameters.name: t1
parameters.description: The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 31 days after t0.

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 31 days. The default is 31 days.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 1000. Default is 50.

parameters.name: startingAfter
parameters.description: A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

parameters.name: endingBefore
parameters.description: A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

parameters.name: adminId
parameters.description: Filter the results by the ID of the admin who made the API requests

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Filter the results by the path of the API requests

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: Filter the results by the method of the API requests (must be 'GET', 'PUT', 'POST' or 'DELETE')

parameters.name: responseCode
parameters.description: Filter the results by the response code of the API requests

parameters.name: sourceIp
parameters.description: Filter the results by the IP address of the originating API request

parameters.name: userAgent
parameters.description: Filter the results by the user agent string of the API request

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Filter the results by the API version of the API request

parameters.name: operationIds
parameters.description: Filter the results by one or more operation IDs for the API request

adminId.description: Database ID for the admin user who made the API request.

method.description: HTTP method used in the API request.

host.description: The host which the API request was directed at.

queryString.description: The query string sent with the API request.

ts.description: Timestamp, in iso8601 format, indicating when the API request was made.

sourceIp.description: Public IP address from which the API request was made.

Link.description: A comma-separated list of first, last, prev, and next relative links used for subsequent paginated requests.

get.description: Return the third party VPN peers for an organization

name.description: The name of the VPN peer

publicIp.description: [optional] The public IP of the VPN peer

remoteId.description: [optional] The remote ID is used to identify the connecting VPN peer. This can either be a valid IPv4 Address, FQDN or User FQDN.

localId.description: [optional] The local ID is used to identify the MX to the peer. This will apply to all MXs this peer applies to.

secret.description: The shared secret with the VPN peer

privateSubnets.description: The list of the private subnets of the VPN peer

ikeCipherAlgo.description: This is the cipher algorithm to be used in Phase 1. The value should be an array with one of the following algorithms: 'aes256', 'aes192', 'aes128', 'tripledes', 'des'

ikeAuthAlgo.description: This is the authentication algorithm to be used in Phase 1. The value should be an array with one of the following algorithms: 'sha256', 'sha1', 'md5'

ikePrfAlgo.description: [optional] This is the pseudo-random function to be used in IKE_SA. The value should be an array with one of the following algorithms: 'prfsha256', 'prfsha1', 'prfmd5', 'default'. The 'default' option can be used to default to the Authentication algorithm.

ikeDiffieHellmanGroup.description: This is the Diffie-Hellman group to be used in Phase 1. The value should be an array with one of the following algorithms: 'group14', 'group5', 'group2', 'group1'

ikeLifetime.description: The lifetime of the Phase 1 SA in seconds.

childCipherAlgo.description: This is the cipher algorithms to be used in Phase 2. The value should be an array with one or more of the following algorithms: 'aes256', 'aes192', 'aes128', 'tripledes', 'des', 'null'

childAuthAlgo.description: This is the authentication algorithms to be used in Phase 2. The value should be an array with one of the following algorithms: 'sha256', 'sha1', 'md5'

childPfsGroup.description: This is the Diffie-Hellman group to be used for Perfect Forward Secrecy in Phase 2. The value should be an array with one of the following values: 'disabled','group14', 'group5', 'group2', 'group1'

childLifetime.description: The lifetime of the Phase 2 SA in seconds.

ipsecPolicies.description: Custom IPSec policies for the VPN peer. If not included and a preset has not been chosen, the default preset for IPSec policies will be used.

ipsecPoliciesPreset.description: One of the following available presets: 'default', 'aws', 'azure'. If this is provided, the 'ipsecPolicies' parameter is ignored.

ikeVersion.description: [optional] The IKE version to be used for the IPsec VPN peer configuration. Defaults to '1' when omitted.

networkTags.description: A list of network tags that will connect with this peer. Use ['all'] for all networks. Use ['none'] for no networks. If not included, the default is ['all'].

get.description: List the branding policies of an organization
get.summary: List the branding policies of an organization

post.description: Add a new branding policy to an organization

name.description: Name of the Dashboard branding policy.

enabled.description: Boolean indicating whether this policy is enabled.

appliesTo.description: Which kinds of admins this policy applies to. Can be one of 'All organization admins', 'All enterprise admins', 'All network admins', 'All admins of networks...', 'All admins of networks tagged...', 'Specific admins...', 'All admins' or 'All SAML admins'.

values.description:
If 'appliesTo' is set to one of 'Specific admins...', 'All admins of networks...' or 'All admins of networks tagged...', then you must specify this 'values' property to provide the set of
    entities to apply the branding policy to. For 'Specific admins...', specify an array of admin IDs. For 'All admins of
    networks...', specify an array of network IDs and/or configuration template IDs. For 'All admins of networks tagged...',
    specify an array of tag names.

adminSettings.description: Settings for describing which kinds of admins this policy applies to.

helpTab.description:
The Help tab, under which all support information resides. If this tab is hidden, no other 'Help' branding
    customizations will be visible. Can be one of 'default or inherit', 'hide' or 'show'.

getHelpSubtab.description:
The 'Help -> Get Help' subtab on which Cisco Meraki KB, Product Manuals, and Support/Case Information are displayed. Note
    that if this subtab is hidden, branding customizations for the KB on 'Get help', Cisco Meraki product documentation,
    and support contact info will not be visible. Can be one of 'default or inherit', 'hide' or 'show'.

communitySubtab.description: The 'Help -> Community' subtab which provides a link to Meraki Community. Can be one of 'default or inherit', 'hide' or 'show'.

casesSubtab.description:
The 'Help -> Cases' Dashboard subtab on which Cisco Meraki support cases for this organization can be managed. Can be one
    of 'default or inherit', 'hide' or 'show'.

dataProtectionRequestsSubtab.description:
The 'Help -> Data protection requests' Dashboard subtab on which requests to delete, restrict, or export end-user data can
    be audited. Can be one of 'default or inherit', 'hide' or 'show'.

getHelpSubtabKnowledgeBaseSearch.description: The KB search box which appears on the Help page. Can be one of 'default or inherit', 'hide', 'show', or a replacement custom HTML string.

universalSearchKnowledgeBaseSearch.description:
The universal search box always visible on Dashboard will, by default, present results from the Meraki KB. This configures
    whether these Meraki KB results should be returned. Can be one of 'default or inherit', 'hide' or 'show'.

ciscoMerakiProductDocumentation.description: The 'Product Manuals' section of the 'Help -> Get Help' subtab. Can be one of 'default or inherit', 'hide', 'show', or a replacement custom HTML string.

supportContactInfo.description: The 'Contact Meraki Support' section of the 'Help -> Get Help' subtab. Can be one of 'default or inherit', 'hide', 'show', or a replacement custom HTML string.

newFeaturesSubtab.description: The 'Help -> New features' subtab where new Dashboard features are detailed. Can be one of 'default or inherit', 'hide' or 'show'.

firewallInfoSubtab.description:
The 'Help -> Firewall info' subtab where necessary upstream firewall rules for communication to the Cisco Meraki cloud are
    listed. Can be one of 'default or inherit', 'hide' or 'show'.

apiDocsSubtab.description:
The 'Help -> API docs' subtab where a detailed description of the Dashboard API is listed. Can be one of
    'default or inherit', 'hide' or 'show'.

hardwareReplacementsSubtab.description:
The 'Help -> Replacement info' subtab where important information regarding device replacements is detailed. Can be one of
    'default or inherit', 'hide' or 'show'.

smForums.description:
The 'SM Forums' subtab which links to community-based support for Cisco Meraki Systems Manager. Only configurable for
    organizations that contain Systems Manager networks. Can be one of 'default or inherit', 'hide' or 'show'.

helpSettings.description:
Settings for describing the modifications to various Help page features. Each property in this object accepts one of
    'default or inherit' (do not modify functionality), 'hide' (remove the section from Dashboard), or 'show' (always show
    the section on Dashboard). Some properties in this object also accept custom HTML used to replace the section on
    Dashboard; see the documentation for each property to see the allowed values.
 Each property defaults to 'default or inherit' when not provided.

enabled.description: Whether or not there is a custom logo enabled.

contents.description: The file contents (a base 64 encoded string) of your new logo.

format.description: The format of the encoded contents.  Supported formats are 'png', 'gif', and jpg'. Note that all images are saved as PNG files, regardless of the format they are uploaded in.

customLogo.description: Properties describing the custom logo attached to the branding policy.

post.description: Claim a list of devices, licenses, and/or orders into an organization. When claiming by order, all devices and licenses in the order will be claimed; licenses will be added to the organization and devices will be placed in the organization's inventory.

mode.description: Either 'renew' or 'addDevices'. 'addDevices' will increase the license limit, while 'renew' will extend the amount of time until expiration. Defaults to 'addDevices'. get.description: Return all the ports of a switch profile

portId.description: The identifier of the switch profile port.

name.description: The name of the switch profile port.

tags.description: The list of tags of the switch profile port.

enabled.description: The status of the switch profile port.

poeEnabled.description: The PoE status of the switch profile port.

type.description: The type of the switch profile port ('trunk' or 'access').

vlan.description: The VLAN of the switch profile port. A null value will clear the value set for trunk ports.

voiceVlan.description: The voice VLAN of the switch profile port. Only applicable to access ports.

allowedVlans.description: The VLANs allowed on the switch profile port. Only applicable to trunk ports.

isolationEnabled.description: The isolation status of the switch profile port.

rstpEnabled.description: The rapid spanning tree protocol status.

stpGuard.description: The state of the STP guard ('disabled', 'root guard', 'bpdu guard' or 'loop guard').

linkNegotiation.description: The link speed for the switch profile port.

linkNegotiationCapabilities.description: Available link speeds for the switch profile port.

portScheduleId.description: The ID of the port schedule. A value of null will clear the port schedule.

udld.description: The action to take when Unidirectional Link is detected (Alert only, Enforce). Default configuration is Alert only.

accessPolicyType.description: The type of the access policy of the switch profile port. Only applicable to access ports. Can be one of 'Open', 'Custom access policy', 'MAC allow list' or 'Sticky MAC allow list'.

accessPolicyNumber.description: The number of a custom access policy to configure on the switch profile port. Only applicable when 'accessPolicyType' is 'Custom access policy'.

macAllowList.description: Only devices with MAC addresses specified in this list will have access to this port. Up to 20 MAC addresses can be defined. Only applicable when 'accessPolicyType' is 'MAC allow list'.

stickyMacAllowList.description: The initial list of MAC addresses for sticky Mac allow list. Only applicable when 'accessPolicyType' is 'Sticky MAC allow list'.

stickyMacAllowListLimit.description: The maximum number of MAC addresses for sticky MAC allow list. Only applicable when 'accessPolicyType' is 'Sticky MAC allow list'.

stormControlEnabled.description: The storm control status of the switch profile port.

flexibleStackingEnabled.description: For supported switches (e.g. MS420/MS425), whether or not the port has flexible stacking enabled.

daiTrusted.description: If true, ARP packets for this port will be considered trusted, and Dynamic ARP Inspection will allow the traffic.

parameters.name: configurationUpdatedAfter
parameters.description: Filter results by whether or not the device's configuration has been updated after the given timestamp

parameters.name: networkIds
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter devices by network.

parameters.name: productTypes
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter devices by product type. Valid types are wireless, appliance, switch, systemsManager, camera, cellularGateway, and sensor.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter devices by tags.

parameters.name: tagsFilterType
parameters.description: Optional parameter of value 'withAnyTags' or 'withAllTags' to indicate whether to return networks which contain ANY or ALL of the included tags. If no type is included, 'withAnyTags' will be selected.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter devices by name. All returned devices will have a name that contains the search term or is an exact match.

parameters.name: mac
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter devices by MAC address. All returned devices will have a MAC address that contains the search term or is an exact match.

parameters.name: serial
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter devices by serial number. All returned devices will have a serial number that contains the search term or is an exact match.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter devices by model. All returned devices will have a model that contains the search term or is an exact match.

parameters.name: macs
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter devices by one or more MAC addresses. All returned devices will have a MAC address that is an exact match.

parameters.name: serials
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter devices by one or more serial numbers. All returned devices will have a serial number that is an exact match.

parameters.name: sensorMetrics
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter devices by the metrics that they provide. Only applies to sensor devices.

parameters.name: sensorAlertProfileIds
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter devices by the alert profiles that are bound to them. Only applies to sensor devices.

parameters.name: models
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter devices by one or more models. All returned devices will have a model that is an exact match.

Link.description: A comma-separated list of first, last, prev, and next relative links used for subsequent paginated requests.

get.description: Return the uplink loss and latency for every MX in the organization from at latest 2 minutes ago

parameters.name: t0
parameters.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 60 days from today.

parameters.name: t1
parameters.description: The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 5 minutes after t0. The latest possible time that t1 can be is 2 minutes into the past.

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 5 minutes. The default is 5 minutes.

parameters.name: uplink
parameters.description: Optional filter for a specific WAN uplink. Valid uplinks are wan1, wan2, cellular. Default will return all uplinks.

parameters.name: ip
parameters.description: Optional filter for a specific destination IP. Default will return all destination IPs.

post.description: Claim a list of devices, licenses, and/or orders into an organization inventory. When claiming by order, all devices and licenses in the order will be claimed; licenses will be added to the organization and devices will be placed in the organization's inventory. Use /organizations/{organizationId}/inventory/release to release devices from an organization.

orders.description: The numbers of the orders that should be claimed

serials.description: The serials of the devices that should be claimed

mode.description: Co-term licensing only: either 'renew' or 'addDevices'. 'addDevices' will increase the license limit, while 'renew' will extend the amount of time until expiration. Defaults to 'addDevices'. All licenses must be claimed with the same mode, and at most one renewal can be claimed at a time. Does not apply to organizations using per-device licensing model.

licenses.description: The licenses that should be claimed

get.description: Returns the login security settings for an organization.

enforcePasswordExpiration.description: Boolean indicating whether users are forced to change their password every X number of days.

passwordExpirationDays.description: Number of days after which users will be forced to change their password.

enforceDifferentPasswords.description: Boolean indicating whether users, when setting a new password, are forced to choose a new password that is different from any past passwords.

numDifferentPasswords.description: Number of recent passwords that new password must be distinct from.

enforceStrongPasswords.description: Boolean indicating whether users will be forced to choose strong passwords for their accounts. Strong passwords are at least 8 characters that contain 3 of the following: number, uppercase letter, lowercase letter, and symbol

enforceAccountLockout.description: Boolean indicating whether users' Dashboard accounts will be locked out after a specified number of consecutive failed login attempts.

accountLockoutAttempts.description: Number of consecutive failed login attempts after which users' accounts will be locked.

enforceIdleTimeout.description: Boolean indicating whether users will be logged out after being idle for the specified number of minutes.

idleTimeoutMinutes.description: Number of minutes users can remain idle before being logged out of their accounts.

enforceTwoFactorAuth.description: Boolean indicating whether users in this organization will be required to use an extra verification code when logging in to Dashboard. This code will be sent to their mobile phone via SMS, or can be generated by the Google Authenticator application.

enforceLoginIpRanges.description: Boolean indicating whether organization will restrict access to Dashboard (including the API) from certain IP addresses.

loginIpRanges.description: List of acceptable IP ranges. Entries can be single IP addresses, IP address ranges, and CIDR subnets.

enabled.description: Boolean indicating whether the organization will restrict API key (not Dashboard GUI) usage to a specific list of IP addresses or CIDR ranges.

ranges.description: List of acceptable IP ranges. Entries can be single IP addresses, IP address ranges, and CIDR subnets.

apiAuthentication.description: Details for indicating whether organization will restrict access to API (but not Dashboard) to certain IP addresses.

enforceTwoFactorAuth.description: Boolean indicating whether users in this organization will be required to use an extra verification code when logging in to Dashboard. This code will be sent to their mobile phone via SMS, or can be generated by the Google Authenticator application.

enforceLoginIpRanges.description: Boolean indicating whether organization will restrict access to Dashboard (including the API) from certain IP addresses.

loginIpRanges.description: List of acceptable IP ranges. Entries can be single IP addresses, IP address ranges, and CIDR subnets.

enabled.description: Boolean indicating whether the organization will restrict API key (not Dashboard GUI) usage to a specific list of IP addresses or CIDR ranges.

ranges.description: List of acceptable IP ranges. Entries can be single IP addresses, IP address ranges, and CIDR subnets.

apiAuthentication.description: Details for indicating whether organization will restrict access to API (but not Dashboard) to certain IP addresses.

get.description: Return all reported readings from sensors in a given timespan, sorted by timestamp

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 1000. Default is 1000.

parameters.name: startingAfter
parameters.description: A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

parameters.name: endingBefore
parameters.description: A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

parameters.name: t0
parameters.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 365 days and 6 hours from today.

parameters.name: t1
parameters.description: The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 7 days after t0.

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 7 days. The default is 2 hours.

parameters.name: networkIds
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter readings by network.

parameters.name: serials
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter readings by sensor.

parameters.name: metrics
parameters.description: Types of sensor readings to retrieve. If no metrics are supplied, all available types of readings will be retrieved. Allowed values are battery, button, door, humidity, indoorAirQuality, noise, pm25, temperature, tvoc, and water.

serial.description: Serial number of the sensor that took the reading.

network.description: Network to which the sensor belongs.

ts.description: Time at which the reading occurred, in ISO8601 format.

percentage.description: Remaining battery life.

battery.description: Reading for the 'battery' metric. This will only be present if the 'metric' property equals 'battery'.

pressType.description: Type of button press that occurred.

button.description: Reading for the 'button' metric. This will only be present if the 'metric' property equals 'button'.

open.description: True if the door is open.

door.description: Reading for the 'door' metric. This will only be present if the 'metric' property equals 'door'.

humidity.description: Reading for the 'humidity' metric. This will only be present if the 'metric' property equals 'humidity'.

score.description: Indoor air quality score between 0 and 100.

indoorAirQuality.description: Reading for the 'indoorAirQuality' metric. This will only be present if the 'metric' property equals 'indoorAirQuality'.

level.description: Ambient noise reading in adjusted decibels.

noise.description: Reading for the 'noise' metric. This will only be present if the 'metric' property equals 'noise'.

concentration.description: PM2.5 reading in micrograms per cubic meter.

pm25.description: Reading for the 'pm25' metric. This will only be present if the 'metric' property equals 'pm25'.

temperature.description: Reading for the 'temperature' metric. This will only be present if the 'metric' property equals 'temperature'.

concentration.description: TVOC reading in micrograms per cubic meter.

tvoc.description: Reading for the 'tvoc' metric. This will only be present if the 'metric' property equals 'tvoc'.

water.description: Reading for the 'water' metric. This will only be present if the 'metric' property equals 'water'.

Link.description: A comma-separated list of first, last, prev, and next relative links used for subsequent paginated requests.

get.summary: Return all reported readings from sensors in a given timespan, sorted by timestamp

get.description: Return all reported readings from sensors in a given timespan, summarized as a series of intervals, sorted by interval start time in descending order

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 1000. Default is 1000.

parameters.name: startingAfter
parameters.description: A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

parameters.name: endingBefore
parameters.description: A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

parameters.name: t0
parameters.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 730 days and 12 hours from today.

parameters.name: t1
parameters.description: The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 730 days and 12 hours after t0.

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 730 days and 12 hours. The default is 7 days. If interval is provided, the timespan will be autocalculated.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: The time interval in seconds for returned data. The valid intervals are: 15, 120, 300, 900, 3600, 14400, 86400, 604800. The default is 86400. Interval is calculated if time params are provided.

parameters.name: networkIds
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter readings by network.

parameters.name: serials
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter readings by sensor.

parameters.name: metrics
parameters.description: Types of sensor readings to retrieve. If no metrics are supplied, all available types of readings will be retrieved. Allowed values are battery, button, door, humidity, indoorAirQuality, noise, pm25, temperature, tvoc, and water.

parameters.name: models
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter readings by one or more models. Allowed values are MT10, MT11, MT12, MT14, MT20, and MT30.

startTs.description: Starting time of the interval, in ISO8601 format.

endTs.description: Ending time of the interval, in ISO8601 format.

serial.description: Serial number of the sensor that took the reading.

model.description: Model of the sensor that took the reading.

network.description: Network to which the sensor belongs.

minimum.description: Minimum battery life reading as a percentage.

maximum.description: Maximum battery life reading as a percentage.

average.description: Average battery life reading as a percentage.

percentage.description: Aggregated battery life readings as a percentage.

battery.description: Reading information over the interval for the 'battery' metric. This will only be present if the 'metric' property equals 'battery'.

short.description: Number of times that a short press was performed.

long.description: Number of times that a long press was performed.

counts.description: Accumulated button presses by press type.

pressType.description: Accumulated counts of button press readings.

button.description: Reading information over the interval for the 'button' metric. This will only be present if the 'metric' property equals 'button'.

open.description: Number of times the door was opened.

door.description: Reading information over the interval for the 'door' metric. This will only be present if the 'metric' property equals 'door'.

humidity.description: Reading information over the interval for the 'humidity' metric. This will only be present if the 'metric' property equals 'humidity'.

minimum.description: Minimum indoor air quality reading as a score between 0-100.

maximum.description: Maximum indoor air quality reading as a score between 0-100.

average.description: Average indoor air quality reading as a score between 0-100.

score.description: Aggregated indoor air quality readings as a score between 0-100.

indoorAirQuality.description: Reading information over the interval for the 'indoorAirQuality' metric. This will only be present if the 'metric' property equals 'indoorAirQuality'.

minimum.description: Minimum ambient noise reading in adjusted decibels.

maximum.description: Maximum ambient noise reading in adjusted decibels.

average.description: Average ambient noise reading in adjusted decibels.

level.description: Aggregated ambient noise readings in adjusted decibels.

noise.description: Reading information over the interval for the 'noise' metric. This will only be present if the 'metric' property equals 'noise'.

minimum.description: Minimum PM2.5 reading in micrograms per cubic meter.

maximum.description: Maximum PM2.5 reading in micrograms per cubic meter.

average.description: Average PM2.5 reading in micrograms per cubic meter.

concentration.description: Aggregated PM2.5 readings in micrograms per cubic meter.

pm25.description: Reading information over the interval for the 'pm25' metric. This will only be present if the 'metric' property equals 'pm25'.

minimum.description: Minimum temperature reading in degrees Fahrenheit.

maximum.description: Maximum temperature reading in degrees Fahrenheit.

average.description: Average temperature reading in degrees Fahrenheit.

fahrenheit.description: Aggregated temperature readings in degrees Fahrenheit.

minimum.description: Minimum temperature reading in degrees Celsius.

maximum.description: Maximum temperature reading in degrees Celsius.

average.description: Average temperature reading in degrees Celsius.

celsius.description: Aggregated temperature readings in degrees Celsius.

temperature.description: Reading information over the interval for the 'temperature' metric. This will only be present if the 'metric' property equals 'temperature'.

minimum.description: Minimum TVOC reading in micrograms per cubic meter.

maximum.description: Maximum TVOC reading in micrograms per cubic meter.

average.description: Average TVOC reading in micrograms per cubic meter.

concentration.description: Aggregated TVOC readings in micrograms per cubic meter.

tvoc.description: Reading information over the interval for the 'tvoc' metric. This will only be present if the 'metric' property equals 'tvoc'.

present.description: Number of times that water was detected.

counts.description: Accumulated counts of water detection readings.

water.description: Reading information over the interval for the 'water' metric. This will only be present if the 'metric' property equals 'water'.

Link.description: A comma-separated list of first, last, prev, and next relative links used for subsequent paginated requests.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 50. Default is 50.

parameters.name: startingAfter
parameters.description: A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

parameters.name: endingBefore
parameters.description: A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

parameters.name: extendedParams
parameters.description: Optional flag to return all of the switchport data vs smaller dataset

parameters.name: networkIds
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter switchports by network.

parameters.name: portProfileIds
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter switchports belonging to the specified switchport profiles.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter switchports belonging to switches by name. All returned switches will have a name that contains the search term or is an exact match.

parameters.name: mac
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter switchports belonging to switches by MAC address. All returned switches will have a MAC address that contains the search term or is an exact match.

parameters.name: macs
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter switchports by one or more MAC addresses belonging to devices. All switchports returned belong to MAC addresses of switches that are an exact match.

parameters.name: serial
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter switchports belonging to switches by serial number. All returned switches will have a serial number that contains the search term or is an exact match.

parameters.name: serials
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter switchports belonging to switches with one or more serial numbers. All switchports returned belong to serial numbers of switches that are an exact match.

parameters.name: configurationUpdatedAfter
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter results by switches where the configuration has been updated after the given timestamp.

mac.description: MAC address of the switch

network.description: The network that the switch belongs to

portId.description: The identifier of the switch port.

name.description: The name of the switch port.

tags.description: The list of tags of the switch port.

enabled.description: The status of the switch port.

poeEnabled.description: The PoE status of the switch port.

type.description: The type of the switch port ('trunk' or 'access').

vlan.description: The VLAN of the switch port. A null value will clear the value set for trunk ports.

voiceVlan.description: The voice VLAN of the switch port. Only applicable to access ports.

allowedVlans.description: The VLANs allowed on the switch port. Only applicable to trunk ports.

rstpEnabled.description: The rapid spanning tree protocol status.

stpGuard.description: The state of the STP guard ('disabled', 'root guard', 'bpdu guard' or 'loop guard').

linkNegotiation.description: The link speed for the switch port.

accessPolicyType.description: The type of the access policy of the switch port. Only applicable to access ports. Can be one of 'Open', 'Custom access policy', 'MAC allow list' or 'Sticky MAC allow list'.

stickyMacAllowList.description: The initial list of MAC addresses for sticky Mac allow list. Only applicable when 'accessPolicyType' is 'Sticky MAC allow list'.

stickyMacAllowListLimit.description: The maximum number of MAC addresses for sticky MAC allow list. Only applicable when 'accessPolicyType' is 'Sticky MAC allow list'.

Link.description: A comma-separated list of first, last, prev, and next relative links used for subsequent paginated requests.
